Justification: To rule out pneumonia or other lung conditions that may be causing the cough and sputum production.
To check for signs of infection or inflammation, such as elevated white blood cell count.
To identify any bacterial infection that may be present in the sputum.
To assess lung function and rule out any underlying respiratory issues.
To rule out COVID-19 as a potential cause of the cough and mild fever.
To check for influenza virus, especially given the symptoms of cough and fever.
